item.title: learning red/rebol
item.description: REBOL/Core Users Guide A walkthrough with Red Helpin’Red Red by Example

item.title: ring
item.description: handler fn: req -> resp middleware fn: handler -> handler request middleware (defn wrap-user [handler user-info] (fn [request] (handler (assoc request :user user-info)))) response middleware (defn wrap-content-type [handler content-type] (fn [request] (let [response (handler request)] (assoc-in response [:headers "Content-Type"] content-type)))) req+resp middleware (defn wrap-cookies [handler options] (fn [request] (-> request (cookies-request options) handler (cookies-response options)))) middleware order: bottom up

item.title: clojure.string/replace
item.description: clojure.string/replace function is interesting! It can accept different types of input data. The form of this function: (clojure.string/replace s match replacement) Where match/replacement can be: string/string (str/replace "The color is red" "red" "blue") ;=> "The color is blue" char/char (str/replace "The color is red" \c \k) ;=> "The kolor is red" pattern/string (str/replace "The color is red" #"red" "blue") ;=> "The color is blue" ;; $1, $2, etc.
